sections.title: Understanding Resources
sections.content: Your empire runs on five core resources. Each serves a distinct purpose, and managing them effectively is the foundation of victory. Running low on any resource constrains your options; running out can be catastrophic.

subsections.title: Credits
subsections.content: Credits are your primary currency. Every purchase in the game costs credits: buildings, spacecraft, and military equipment. Credits accumulate through taxation and trade, making them the most versatile but also the most demanded resource.
keyPoints: Used for all construction and purchases
Also gained from trade and resource conversion
subsections.tip: Watch credit expenditure carefully. Running out of credits halts all economic activity.

subsections.title: Minerals
subsections.content: Minerals represent raw construction materials. Every building and spacecraft requires minerals for construction. Mining Stations extract minerals from planetary deposits at a rate of 50 minerals per turn.
subsections.tip: Volcanic planets have mineral bonuses. Prioritize them for mining operations.

subsections.title: Fuel
subsections.content: Fuel powers your spacecraft. Without fuel, your fleet cannot move between planets. Mining Stations produce fuel alongside minerals at a rate of 30 fuel per turn. Spacecraft consume fuel based on distance traveled and their efficiency rating.
keyPoints: Consumed based on distance and craft type
subsections.warning: A fleet without fuel is stranded. Always ensure fuel reserves before launching expeditions.

subsections.title: Food
subsections.content: Food sustains your population. Each planet needs sufficient food production to maintain its inhabitants. When food runs short, morale plummets and population growth halts. Horticultural Stations produce 100 food per turn.
subsections.tip: Tropical planets excel at food production. Use them to feed your empire.

subsections.title: Energy
subsections.content: Energy powers advanced structures and operations. Solar Satellites generate 80 energy per turn when deployed in planetary orbit. Energy requirements increase as your empire develops more sophisticated infrastructure.

sections.title: Income and Production
sections.content: Each turn during the Income Phase, your planets automatically generate resources. The amount produced depends on several factors: buildings constructed, population allocated, planet type bonuses, and morale level.

subsections.title: Production Buildings
subsections.content: Three building types generate resources: Horticultural Stations produce food, Mining Stations produce minerals and fuel, and Solar Satellites produce energy. Each building requires crew (population) to operate.

subsections.title: Crew Requirements
subsections.content: Buildings need population to operate. If a planet's population is insufficient to staff all buildings, some become inactive. The game automatically prioritizes crew allocation: food production first, then minerals and fuel, then energy.
keyPoints: Each building type has a crew requirement
subsections.tip: Check crew allocation when buildings seem inactive. You may need more population.

subsections.title: Planet Type Bonuses
subsections.content: Different planet types have production multipliers that affect resource output. Building the right structures on the right planets maximizes your economic efficiency.

planetBonuses.strategy: Your home base for military training

sections.title: Population Morale
sections.content: Morale represents your population's satisfaction. High morale means productive workers; low morale means reduced output and potential unrest. Managing morale is essential for a healthy economy.

subsections.title: Morale Impact on Production
subsections.content: When morale drops below 50%, income production is penalized. The penalty scales linearly: 40% morale means 40% of normal production, 25% morale means 25% production, and so on.
subsections.warning: Morale spirals can be devastating. A planet producing less food leads to lower morale, which leads to even less food production.

subsections.title: What Affects Morale
subsections.content: Several factors influence planetary morale. Understanding these helps you maintain happy, productive populations.

factors.effect: Adequate food maintains morale; shortages cause rapid decline
Higher taxes reduce morale; lower taxes improve it
Captured planets start with -30% morale penalty
Each turn under bombardment reduces morale by 20%

subsections.tip: After capturing a planet, lower taxes temporarily to rebuild morale.

sections.title: Building Your Infrastructure
sections.content: Buildings form the backbone of your economy. Constructing the right buildings in the right order determines whether your empire thrives or struggles.

subsections.title: Building Costs and Construction Times
subsections.content: Each building requires resources to construct and takes time to complete. Plan your construction queue carefully to ensure continuous development.

subsections.title: Recommended Build Order
subsections.content: While every game situation is different, this general build order provides a solid foundation for new players.
subsections.tip: Adjust this order based on your planet type. Volcanic planets may prioritize Mining Stations first.

subsections.title: Scrapping Buildings
subsections.content: Buildings can be scrapped (destroyed) to recover 50% of their original cost. This is useful when restructuring your economy or when buildings are no longer needed. Scrapping is permanent and should be used sparingly.

sections.title: Spacecraft and Trade
sections.content: Spacecraft represent major investments but enable critical capabilities: military power, resource transport, and planetary expansion.

subsections.title: Resource Transport
subsections.content: Cargo Cruisers move resources between planets. Each Cargo Cruiser can carry up to 1,000 units of each resource type. Use them to redistribute resources from productive planets to developing ones.
subsections.tip: Establish trade routes between specialized planets. Send minerals from volcanic worlds to feed construction elsewhere.

subsections.title: Colonization
subsections.content: Atmosphere Processors enable colonization of neutral planets. Deploy one at an uninhabited world to begin terraforming. After 10 turns, the planet becomes habitable and joins your empire.
subsections.tip: Target planets with good production bonuses. A volcanic planet is worth the terraforming investment for its mineral output.
